III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(d) Storage of medications.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was able to trade her medication with a staff member,
receiving a different medication in return.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 05/07/2025 and had no
additional information to offer.
Administrator 1 was interviewed 05/02/2025 during an
unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. He was not aware
of any reports of Youth A possibly not taking her medication as
prescribed and a staff member trading that medication with her for
other medication.
Youth A was interviewed on 05/02/2025 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit to the facility. Youth A denied ever “cheeking” or
not taking her medication as prescribed. She denied any staff
trading medications with her and also denied that any staff had
ever asked her about trading medications. Youth A recalled
occasions when she had denied taking her medication but stated
that she had never been able to take the medication from staff and
keep it on her person when this occurred. Youth A also denied
making any claims to other youth or staff that this occurred. Youth
A described the process that staff used for providing medications
to her and commented that she would not be able to take it from
them and not consume it because the staff stay with them and
ensure it is consumed as needed.
Youth B was interviewed on 05/02/2025 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit to the facility. Youth B recalled Youth A stating
to her that Youth A was able to trade her own medications with a
staff member for other medications. Youth B could not recall any
other details that Youth A may have provided when stating this.
Youth B believed there were no other youth or staff around when
Youth A stated this. Youth B recalled not being sure if it was true
2

or not. She believed she reported this information to her DHHS
Foster Care worker but was not sure if she had ever reported it to
any facility staff.
Staff 1, Therapist 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 5 were
interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on 05/23/2025.
All interviewees stated they had never had any concern or been
made aware of the possibility that Youth A traded her own
medications with a staff member.
Staff 6, Staff 7 and Staff 8 were interviewed over the phone on
06/04/2025. They all stated they had not been made aware of any
situation where Youth A traded medications with a staff member.
Documents reviewed:
• Facility policy titled “Medication Administration” was
provided and reviewed. This policy outlined procedures for
staff to administer medications properly, including requiring
that staff “carefully watch the client take oral medication
and verify all medications have been swallowed by
checking the mouth for any retained medication.”
• Facility Medication Administration Records for Youth A
covering the month of April 2025 were provided and
reviewed. There were several occasions when Youth A
refused taking her medications, but the documentation did
not indicate any instances when Youth A attempted to
“cheek” her medication or take if from staff without
consuming it properly.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per interviews with youth
and staff and documentation reviewed there was no evidence
found that Youth A had ever been able to procure her medication
without properly taking it to then trade it with anyone else.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty
to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency's program statement
and to provide for the continual needs, protection, and
supervision of residents
3

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A suffocated Youth C with a pillow during nighttime when
staff should have seen and prevented this.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 05/07/2025 and had no
additional information to offer.
Administrator 1 was interviewed 05/02/2025 during an
unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Incident reports
involving Youth A and Youth C were reviewed and he stated that
none involved any situations similar to what was listed in the
allegations.
Youth C was interviewed on 05/02/2025 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit to the facility. She recalled an incident where
she was in her bedroom after bedtime. The door to her bedroom
was open. Youth C recalled Youth A coming to her doorway and
at that time Youth A was holding a pillow. Youth C could not
remember if Youth A said anything. Youth C felt like Youth A was
going to try to suffocate her. When asked why she felt that way,
Youth C recalled past instances where she felt like Youth A made
inappropriate or threatening remarks about or to Youth C. Youth
C could not recall if Youth A came into her bedroom or not. Youth
C recalled after only a few seconds a staff member told Youth A to
go back to her own bedroom. Youth C remembered Youth A
walking away and Youth C did not see her for the rest of the night.
Youth C could not recall any other details of the incident. She
confirmed Youth A never came all the way in Youth C’s bedroom
and never touched or assaulted Youth C. Youth C believed she
told her Foster Care caseworker about the incident, and possibly
some staff although she could not remember specifically who.
Youth A was interviewed on 05/02/2025 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit to the facility. She could not recall specific
instances of being at Youth C’s bedroom after bedtime hours.
She believed there was a time she helped Youth C fold laundry
inside of Youth C’s room, with a staff supervising from the
doorway. Youth A denied ever assaulting or attempting to
suffocate Youth C. Youth A commented that staff are aware of
where youth are after bedtime and that youth are not supposed to
go into to each other’s bedrooms.
4

Youth A’s Foster Care worker was contacted on 05/08/2025.
She was not aware of any possible situations where Youth A had
attempted to suffocate another youth.
Staff 1, Therapist 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 5 were
interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on 05/23/2025.
All interviewees stated they had not experienced or been made
aware of any situations similar to what was described in the
allegations.
Staff 6, Staff 7 and Staff 8 were interviewed over the phone on
06/04/2025. They all stated they had not experienced or been
made aware of any situations similar to what was described in the
allegations.
Youth C’s Foster Care worker was contacted on 06/04/2025.
She recalled Youth C informing her of the alleged incident where
Youth A attempted to suffocate Youth C. Youth C’s Foster Care
worker was not sure if it was true or not and stated that she
contacted appropriate parties through MDHHS regarding the
allegations.
Documents reviewed:
• Facility policy titled “Client Supervision” last dated March
2021 was provided and reviewed. This policy outlines staff
procedures to ensure that youth are supervised at all times.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per interviews with youth
and staff there was no evidence found that an incident occurred
where Youth A attempted to suffocate Youth C and staff were not
available and supervising.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
